Places.description: Our Executive Chauffeur with Highly experienced Licenced English speaking guide will report at your place of stay within Hyderabad city limits to embark onto the most impregnable Fort at Golconda, which is 12 kms approximately from Hyderabad city hotels. You have an option to see the panoramic views from Baradari after you climb 365 steps one way up. You have also an option to explore 90% of Fort area by walk. Guide will clap to wake up the napping guards !!! Incredible Eco system can reach 400 ft top. The Tour will continue to see the Royal Necropolis (Qutub Shahi tombs) of Golconda Rulers and further to explore lots of monuments in the old part of Hyderabad.
Places.title: Full Day Sightseeing Tour of Hyderabad

Places.description:
Grand Heritage Walk starts with the Special Masala HiTea of Nizamâ€™s blend or an English HiTea, served either at Celeste, Gol Bungalow or Jade Terrace. 

Falaknuma Palace (India's one of the most Opulent Palaces) Perched 2,000 feet atop the City of Pearls, is indeed a mirror of the sky nestled among clouds is spread in 32 acres. This 1894 masterpiece has an elaborate design, eloquent stucco work and timeless elegance is like retracing the paths of Nizams, walking in step with the European royalty, feeling the presence of the flamboyant Begums, walking arm-in-arm with distinguished Heads of the State and walk the Kings way, slicing your path through the choicest architecture. AÂ journey into the blue skies, into the glided ages of time immemorial, where grandeur and lavishness is all you see with the palace historian, Prabhakar Mahindrakar, A towering figure of a man, dressed in a flowing black sherwani, he walks softly over the rosewood parquet
Places.title: Heritage Walk with HiTea at Falaknuma Palace

Places.description:
Experience authentic Hyderabad on this amazing walking tour of the old town with our fun and entertaining storytellers. This walking tour will give you a great induction of the city, its history, its vibrant culture, and its people with lots of wonderful stories about the city, fun facts and must do things in the city.

Our walks are blend of historical elucidation and curious anecdote laced with mildly scurrilous talk about past and present celebrities and defunct royals. We will cover some of the city highlights along with hidden places and forgotten nooks of the old city during the walk. 

Highlights:
1. Explore Hyderabad beyond the typical tourist spots and enjoy the stories and tales about the city from your guide 
2. See the city through the eyes of a local and discover the numerous mesmerizing places Hyderabad has to offer. 
3. Capture the vibrant atmosphere of this colorful city on this memorable walking tour with an infotainment-style ensuring that you will not be bored.
Places.title: Heritage & Cultural Walk of Hyderabad (2 Hours Guided Walking Tour)

Places.description:
The Old City Heritage Walk is an immersive walking tour in Hyderabad which takes you back 400 years in time back to the times of the Qutb Shahi Sultans who built the city and left a lasting cultural legacy. As we walk past the palatial mansions and mosques of a bygone era we will also relive the life and times of the Nizams of Hyderabad in this walking tour. The walk commences at the famed Charminar and ends at Chowmahalla Palace of the Nizams.

Our company is committed to strengthening local communities. We help train and employ local guides and support local businesses to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.
Places.title: Old City Walking tour in Hyderabad, travel back 400 years in time

Places.description: Enjoy sweeping views of Old Hyderabad from the Charminar and walk through history at the Chowmahalla Palace. This 4-hour, small group tour takes you up one of the best preserved monuments from the time Hyderabad was built in 1591 CE â€“ the Charminar. Take a walk through the picturesque Chudi Bazaar, filled with hundreds of shops selling the shiny and colorful Hyderabadi lac bangles and clothes. Visit the Chowmahalla Palace from which the Nizams ruled Hyderabad for over 200 years.Â Add-ons include transport, tickets to monuments and food.
Places.title: The City of Pearls Walking Tour

Places.description: Relive the glorious past of Hyderabad when it was one of the richest and most powerful cities in the world, in the company of an expert. Take a peek into the opulent lives of the Nizams who used diamonds as paper weights! Unravel the secrets of Qutub Shahi Kings who founded the city. The itinerary covers the spellbinding Golconda Fort, majestic Qutub Shahi tombs, the lavish Chowmahalla Palace of the Nizams and romantic Charminar, the most iconic monument of Hyderabad.
Places.title: Private tour of Hyderabad with lunch for a cultural immersion

Places.description: The Half Day Walking Tour - driven by the professional tour guides who have historical inter sight into Hyderabad's archaeology, heritage and culture will take you through ancient and medieval ages of the City involves 400+ years of long history back in Qutb Shahi times and continue the legacy by the Nizams of Hyderabad. History enthusiasts will love exploring Hyderabadâ€™s fascinating past by visiting old city sites.
Places.title: Hyderabad - Old City Walking Tour, Captivates 400+ Years History

Places.description:
Hyderabad is a beautiful city during the day, yet it is even more beautiful at night. Come and join us on this amazing and completely off beat experience of the city at night. Explore the glimmering streets of Hyderabad in the evening hours and take a tour of the famous architectures, visit local popular hangout places, most prominent, beautiful monuments, ancient buildings and old streets in the beautiful night view of the city. 
Highlights
1. As the atmosphere will cool down, calmness will slowly start to take over with a mix of the sound of music and mass in the city, we will explore interesting combination of places to help you experience the nightlife in Mysore.
2. Witness the brightly lighted ancient building. the illuminated prominent beautiful monuments in night view.
3. We follow a unique style of â€˜infotainmentâ€™ to ensure that you enjoy the tour and don't get bored, irrespective of whether you love history or not.
Places.title: Night Walk Hyderabad (2 Hour Guided Walking Tour)

Places.description: Our Char Bagh Heritage Walking tour it new Product i did my own research to made plan for my tourists this will start at One of the oldest Ashookhana in the world. A Place of Mourning for Shia Muslims Constructed in memory of martyrdom of Imam Hussein in 1593 with high Quality of colorful Mosaics from Persia, then walk continue Through Visit Places of Historical and Religious Importance visit to Naal Saab Mubarak - Mir Alam Mandi - Irani Galli - Barga- e- Panjeshan - Qadam -e-Rasool, Gulzar Houz or Char su - ka - Houz - Charminar .
Places.title: Old city Walking Tour in Charminar

Places.description:
In this half day Hyderabad tour, we experience the spellbinding Golconda Fort which is a marvel in acoustic engineering and as impregnable as a fort can get! We will also visit the Qutub Shahi tombs, built in memory of Kings of this dynasty who had a penchant for building beautiful monuments. Even their tombs are spectacular withÂ arches, columns, domes minarets and galleries!

This tour is organized by Five Senses Tours, a private limited company recognized by the Ministry of Tourism and a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators (IATO). The tour has been designed to support local livelihoods by way of employment of local guides, and supporting local businesses in line with the mission of the company to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.
Places.title: Half day Hyderabad tour to Golkonda fort & Qutub Shahi tombs in private car

Places.description: Explore the walled Old City of Hyderabad and visit its famous landmarks on this 4-hour tour. You will start this fantastic tour by visiting 8 kms circumference lake Hussein Sagar with the world's largest monolithic granite statue of Buddha, lumbini park, en route with the Birla Temple Hills, pass through state legislative assembly enter the old city area with oldest nampalli train station, Badshahi ashurkhana and then smell the pearl, spice, cloth market walking tour, charkamans and then finally the Charminar. You have an option to use the stairs (payment directly), the largest mosque in the city, Sip the Irani chai Bangle Street and finally end up at Paiga Tombs and then back to your place of stay.
Places.title: Half-Day (4Hrs) Tour of Hyderabad's Historic & Cultural part of Old City

Places.description:
Hyderabad Biryani and street food is a Hyderabad street food walk in the evening. Over 2.5 hours we will savour the best street food, Hyderabad has to offer. We visit the best restaurants for the most famous local delicacies. On the menu is the legendary Hyderabad Biryani, mouth-watering Kababs , Hyderabadi dessert and Irani Chai with Osmania biscuits.

This tour is organized by Five Senses Tours, a private limited company recognized by the Ministry of Tourism and a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators (IATO). The tour has been designed to support local livelihoods by way of employment of local guides, and supporting local businesses in line with the mission of the company to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.
Places.title: Evening Hyderabad Street Food Walk with Hyderabad Biryani

Places.description:
In this half day Hyderabad tour, we experience the legacy of the Nizams by visiting the incredibly lavish Chowmahalla Palace and the magnificent collection of SalarJung at his Museum. We will end the tour at Charminar, the icon which symbolizes the grandeur of Hyderabad.

This tour is organized by Five Senses Tours, a private limited company recognized by the Ministry of Tourism and a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators (IATO). The tour has been designed to support local livelihoods by way of employment of local guides, and supporting local businesses in line with the mission of the company to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.

Places.description:
Hyderabad or the City of the Nizams is famous for its luxurious palaces and the personal collection of several generations of Nizams. Falaknuma Palace is perhaps the most lavish of all palaces in India. Take a guided tour of this enchanting palace that has now been converted into a luxury hotel of the Taj Group and re-discover the grandeur of a bygone era.

NOTE: (Expect More People on Restaurant / Public Places During the Lunch and Palace Tour).

Highlights:

 â€¢ Library with carved walnut roof 

 â€¢ State Reception Room 

 â€¢ Ballroom with a two-tonne manually operated organ 

 â€¢ Longest dining table of the world 

 â€¢ A Burroughs & Watts Billiards table
Places.title: Guided Tour Of Falaknuma Palace, Hyderabad With Lunch

Places.description:
Discover all the beautiful and famous sites of Hydrabad and taste local delicacies on this fantastic 8-hour experience with a personal guide in an air-conditioned car. 
Highlights:
Discover the marvelous monumnets, colorful markets, ruins of fort and lake spilled across the city. We have designed this beautiful garland of all the places in our Trails of Hydrabad tour, an unmatched heritage experience with awesome stories to understand a city's existence, culture and local trivia. 
1. Visit scenic and beautiful hilltop Golconda Fort, Chowmahalla Palace, Charminar markets and listen to stories of the city's history, culture and life. 
2. Explore the famous Hussain Sagar Lake & gardens around it, Birla Mandir, Salar Jung Museum, Madina Mosque and many other tourists places.
3. Complete the tour with a big smile on your face and beautiful memories to cherish in your photos.
Places.title: Tourisct Highlights of the Hyderabad (Guided Fullday Sightseeing Tour by Car)

Places.description:
Discover all the beautiful and famous Ramoji Film City and Sanghi Temple in Hydrabad, taste local delicacies on this fantastic 8-hour experience with a personal driver cum guide in an air-conditioned car. 
Highlights:
1. Visit scenic and beautiful hilltop Sanghi Temple located on the top of Paramanand Giri hill with very tall sacred Raja Gopuram and listen to stories of the its's history, culture and life. 
2. Explore the the largest integrated film city in the world and many other tourists places in the Ramoji Film City.
3. Complete the tour with a big smile on your face and beautiful memories to cherish in your photos.
Places.title: Day Trip to Sanghi Temple & Ramoji Film City (Private Experience by Car)

Places.description:
This tour traces the journey of the famous Diamond from Warangal to the British Crown, and helps rediscover the cultural legacy of the Kakatiya Empire at the world heritage site of Ramappa temple. We also visit Bhadrakali temple where the left eye of the deity used to be the Kohinoor Diamond and the 1000 pillar temple of Warangal to appreciate Kakatiyaâ€™s architecture, progressive social reforms introduced to break the shackles of the caste system and an efficient administrative system appreciated by Marco Polo.

This tour is organized by Five Senses Tours, a private limited company recognized by the Ministry of Tourism and a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators (IATO). The tour has been designed to support local livelihoods by way of employment of local guides, and supporting local businesses in line with the mission of the company to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.
Places.title: World heritage Ramappa temple & Kohinoor diamond tour from Hyderabad by car

Places.description:
This is your call to explore the city of pearls, Hyderabad! Spend an entire day visiting famous destinations in the Telugu capital. Listen to interesting facts about Golconda Fort and the nearby area, and walk across the Qutub Shahi Tombs complex's lush green garden.

Enter the Mecca Masjid, built from sand brought from Mecca city, and capture your moments while seeing Charminar. Notice the vast antique collection on display at Salar Jung Museum and get to see a mixture of architectural work at Chowmahalla Palace.
Places.title: Hyderabad Full Day City Tour with Boat Ride

Places.description:
Explore Heritage Hyderabad in Full-day sightseeing, offering a True Taste of the city's forts, Palaces, Culture, and Shopping.

Explore City landmarks like Qutub Shahi Kingdom and Nizams of Hyderabad and take a glance from Plateau before we continue to Golconda Fort. We'll take advantage of the morning's cooler temperature to visit this medieval structure, a site which was once part of India's Kakatiya Dynasty that dates back to the 11th century.

Why not take a chance to try tasty Hyderabadi Dum Biryani before we proceed to Downtown to see the landmark and symbol of Hyderabad, The Charminar? There you can browse Bangles and 'Attar' (fragrant essential oil) at the famous Laad Bazaar, visit Mecca Masjid Mosque, and experience Irani Chai.

Chowmohalla Palace, Heritage Building Like, Mecca Majid, Unnani Hospital, Char Kamans, High Court of Telangana, Town Hall.

Come with me and discover true Hyderabad, its old traditions and cultures, amazing food, and spectacular sights.
Places.title: Mesmerising Hyderabad Heritage Cultural Tour with Ethnic lunch

Places.description:
Overview

This full day excursion takes you to Srisailam, one of the twelve sacred shrines of Lord Shiva (Jyotirlingas). Explore the famous Srisailam Temple, also known as the Bhramaramba Mallikarjuna Temple. Learn about the history of the temple from your knowledgeable guide.Â 

Highlights

 â€¢ Private transfers to the Srisailam temple 

 â€¢ Guided tour of the Srisailam temple - one of the twelve sacred Lord Shiva Temple, dating back to the 2ndcentury 

 â€¢ Get to know about the history of the temple from your guide
Places.title: Srisailam Temple full day excursion tour

Places.description: Explore the world's best defensive Golconda fort and the world's largest historical complex Qutub Shahi Heritage Complex with a Professional Tour Guide, In the Morning weather, is perfect to explore and the light is suitable for taking pictures, Your guide take you to the bygone era of 11th to 17th centuries ruled by Kakatiya of Warangal, Bahaman of Gulbarga and It is Principal Capital of Qutub Shahi kings of Golconda who are migrated from Hamedan of Persia (modern Iran) who built beautiful Monuments like Baradari, Clapping Portico, Great engineering marvel of water supply and Rani mahal, Golconda diamond Market world-class Kohi-hi-noor diamond was founded in the Golconda mines, Then Proceed to Royal Necropolis of Qutub Shahi kings, Hammams, char Bagh gardens, step wells, great indu-Persian Architecture.
Places.title: Golconda Heritage Half Day Guided Private Tour

Places.description:
If you have only few hours time in the city, please book this private historical heritage walking tour to cover the most visited monuments of Old Hyderabad and it's unique lifestyle and culture. We quote the reasonable market price with professional service to our tourists. All our accompanying guides are academically qualified and professionally licensed. 

This is a very interesting heritage walking tour in Old Hyderabad to witness it's legacy right from the foundation by Qutb Shahiâ€™s of Golkonda Kingdom, influence of Mughals era and continuation by Nizamâ€™s of Hyderabad with its religious and civic buildings with authentic culture and life style for the past 432 years. 

We have not included transportation in this tour. 

We meet the tourists at a meeting point mentioned above which is the starting point of the tour. From tour ending point we help the tourists to get their Uber / Ola cabs. If you still want any help, you can contact us for more details.
Places.title: Half Day Historical Old City Walking Tour in Charminar Hyderabad

Places.description:
Discover all the famous Markets of Hydrabad and taste local delicacies on this fantastic 4-hour experience with a personal guide in an air-conditioned car. 

Highlights:

1. The vibrant atmosphere of Hydrabad markets can make shopping lots of fun. The tour is designed to go beyond the city's streets and explore its bustling markets. 

2. Each market has a unique ambiance and a treasure trove of goods waiting to be discovered ranging from arts and crafts, souvenirs, clothing, food or electronics.

3. If you are a shopaholic and also don't want to burn a hole in your pocket, this tour is not to be missed. We have curated this created a beautiful experience to witness the million colors of Hyderabad and experience it like a local, strolling through its ancient streets.

4. We will also take you to places for food tasting, so that you can also cherish food of Hydrabad, feast your taste buds and have a fabulous and lasting impression.
Places.title: Hyderabad Shopping and Food Tasting Experience (Guided Halfday City Tour by Car)

Places.description: Embark on the "Hyderabad's Grand Heritage City Tour" commencing with a 9:00 AM pick-up from your hotel. Immerse yourself in history at the Golconda Fort, exploring its gateways, palaces, and temples with fascinating insights from your guide. Journey to the Qutb Shahi Tombs, marveling at the intricate mausoleums and delving into the history of the Qutb Shahi dynasty. After a sumptuous Hyderabadi lunch, make your way to the iconic Charminar, a symbol of Hyderabad, surrounded by a vibrant market. Explore the Chowmahalla Palace's regal complex, appreciating the detailed architecture and royal history. Continue to the Salar Jung Museum, showcasing a vast collection of art and artifacts. Conclude your day at Purani Haveli, a museum housing the Nizam's vintage car collection, before a 6:30 PM drop-off at your hotel. Uncover the grandeur and heritage of Hyderabad through its architectural marvels and cultural treasures.
Places.title: Golconda Fort & Hyderabad City Tour

Places.description: In this day tour, we experience the rich cultural heritage of Hyderabad the city of pearls. The itinerary covers the spellbinding Golconda Fort, Choumahalla Palace of the Nizams who were once the richest people on Earth, and the iconic Charminar which is symbolic of Hyderabad. We will end the tour with shopping in Laad Bazaar for Peals & Bangles.
Places.title: Private tour of Hyderabad in car with guide and lunch

Places.description: Embark on a captivating "Journey to the Jyotirlinga: Mallikarjuna Temple Day Tour" commencing at 7:00 am from your Hyderabad hotel. Traverse through scenic landscapes en route to Srisailam in the Nallamala hills of Andhra Pradesh. At 11:00 am, explore the revered Mallikarjuna Temple, a significant Jyotirlinga dedicated to Lord Shiva and Parvati, showcasing a blend of Chalukya and Vijayanagara architectural styles dating back to the 7th century. Delve into the site's intricate carvings and rich history during the 2-hour tour. Following a leisurely lunch at 1:00 pm, visit the nearby Shikaresvara Temple at 2:00 pm, renowned for its 5th-century sculptures depicting gods, goddesses, and mythological figures. Your guide will unravel the temple's history, concluding the day with return to Hyderabad by 4:00 pm, leaving you with indelible memories of this spiritual odyssey.
Places.title: Journey to the Jyotirlinga: Mallikarjuna Temple Day Tour

Places.description:
A great blend of regal history and bold modernity, Hyderabad is a delightful place to visit. As the capital of Telangana, it is always thronging with tourists from far off as well as the locals. There are some epic places to visit in Hyderabad, which will satiate your hunger to explore. This reminds us that the city of Nizams is also popular for its Hyderabadi Biryani which is something not to be missed here.

The new, cosmopolitan area of the city is also filled with a plethora of places like the Golkonda Fort and Salar Jung Museum for the history buffs, Ramoji Film city for the movie buffs, and the glittery malls & clubs dotted all over for the people to have a good time.
Places.title: Full day guided tour of Hyderabad

Places.description: Embark on a captivating "Thousand Pillar Temple, Warangal Fort & Ramappa Temple Tour" from Hyderabad, immersing yourself in the rich heritage of Warangal and its architectural marvels. Your journey commences with a comfortable hotel pick-up, leading you to the iconic Thousand Pillar Temple, a masterpiece of Kakatiya architecture dedicated to Lord Shiva, Lord Vishnu, and Lord Surya. Next, venture to the renowned Ramappa Temple, showcasing exquisite Kakatiya craftsmanship and intricate carvings of Lord Shiva and the Nandi bull. After savoring local delicacies for lunch, explore the majestic Warangal Fort, adorned with stunning palaces and mosques reflecting medieval Indian architecture. Conclude your tour with a visit to the magnificent Kakatiya Kala Thoranam, symbolizing the glory of the Kakatiya dynasty. Finally, return to Hyderabad, brimming with memories of a day filled with historical splendor and architectural wonders.
Places.title: Thousand Pillar Temple, Warangal Fort & Ramappa Temple Tour

Places.description:
Hyderabad is tourist paradise and for centuries it is known for its rich and yummy South Indian food culture, we are fortunate today that this rich food culture is preserved in the form of small food joints by some thoughtful people for generations. We have designed this amazing experience for you with an intention to take you to these places for food tasting, so that you can also cherish this food, feast your taste buds and have a fabulous and lasting impression.

1. You will taste more than five mouth watering authentic delicacies on this food tour, if you are a food lover and enjoy experiencing different kind of foods, then you should not miss this walking tour because trust us, you will surely regret it later.

2. We have designed this amazing experience for you with an intention to take you to these places for food tasting.

3. Be prepared to fill your mouth with mouth watering delights and please bring an appetite.
Places.title: Hyderabad Street Food Crawl (2 Hours Guided Food Tasting Tour)

Places.description: Visit the highlights of the majestic city of Hyderabad that was a part of a larger Hyderabad State ruled by sovereigns called Nizams. Behold the Charminar an imposing monument dominated by four minarets and visit Grand Mecca Masjid, the oldest mosque in the city. We will also take you to the Salar Jung Museum, a treasure trove with its variety of artifacts and well preserved exhibits and the Chowmahalla Palace with its massive Durbar hall. Experience a calm expanse of water in the city â€“ the Hussain Sagar Lake

Places.description:
During this walk, you will visit the temple in the company of our knowledgeable guide. We will also walk through the surrounding areas, where you can see Mylapore in all its crowded chaos. The jewellers, silk merchants, fruit and vegetable sellers and the flower vendors in the bazaars provide a colourful backdrop to the temple. The walk takes us through small lanes with old-style homes, through silk shops, stores selling music and religious memorablia, â€˜kutcheriâ€™ auditoriums, etc. 

 Visit the Kapaleeshwara Temple, the Santhome Church, and walk through the by-lanes of Mylapore during this 3-hour tour. The tour is mostly on foot with a short stretch in an auto-rickshaw (local tuk-tuk) that are arranged and included in the tour and it will end with south Indian refreshments.

Places.description:
Immerse yourself in the authentic essence of Chennai with our captivating walking tour of the old town, led by our fun and engaging storytellers. This tour offers a fantastic introduction to the city, delving into its rich history, vibrant culture, and the warmth of its people, all while sharing fascinating stories, fun facts, and insider tips.

Our walks are a delightful blend of historical insights and intriguing anecdotes, sprinkled with a touch of humor and mild gossip about both past and present luminaries. As we stroll through the old town, we'll explore not only the city's renowned highlights but also uncover hidden gems and forgotten corners, offering you a unique perspective of Chennai's past and present. Join us for an unforgettable journey through the heart of this enchanting city.

Places.description:
This walk is very different because when we go on any tour, we are exploring and experiencing places and things that are outside, but on this tour we will be taking a journey inwards and you will explore the very life within, it could be a life changing experience if you decide to take it in the right perspective.

Connect the dots of spirituality, religion and science to make sense and go beyond the framework of logic, an experience designed to elevate your spiritual journey.
Places.title: Chennai Walk of Divinity

Places.description: Morning you will be picked up from your hotel in Chennai.Spend your day exploring Marina Beach,Chennai's cultural hub of Mylapore Kapaleeshwar Temple and the San Thome Basilica, followed by a traditional South Indian lunch in a local restaurant and visit the shrine at Ramakrishna Math, followed by a visit to the 17th-century Fort Saint George before returning to your hotel.
Places.title: Total Chennai city tour in Private car with guide & lunch by Wonder tours

Places.description: Mamallapuram (also called Mahaballipuram) is about an hour's drive from Chennai on the East Coast Road. It was the second capital and seaport of the Pallava Kings who ruled in the 5th century. Local legend has it that there was once a beautiful city here with seven temples, which the Gods submerged under the sea in anger.until in 2002, an Indo-British team of divers discovered a series of man-made structures under water, covering an area of several square miles.Today at Mamallapuram, you can see the famous Shore Temple, the only surviving temple out of the original seven (the rest have sunk under the sea). The Shore Temple is among the oldest temples of South India and represents the final flowering of Pallava art. Arjuna's Penance, one of the world's biggest bas-reliefs depicts the story of the descent of the River Ganges from Heaven to Earth. Cave temples and massive monolithic sculptures (carved from a single large block of granite) make Mamallapuram a place to remember.
Places.title: Mahabalipuram Private tour from Chennai by car with guide and lunch by Wonder

Places.description:
Georgetown Heritage walk is an immersive walking tour in Chennai. It is organised by a tourism ministry approved company which is also a member of IATO.

This Chennai walk will bring alive the heritage and legacy of Chennai's first settlement. We will trace the evolution of George Town as the trading post for East India Company in the 17th century to its modern avatar as the premier trading hub of Chennai.

Experience cultural diversity in this walking tour in Chennai at streets where traders from many nationalities and communities used to ply their trade including Armenian merchants.

Our company is committed to strengthening local communities. We help train and employ local guides and support local businesses to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent. Our guide will be happy to talk about the community initiatives we undertake.
Places.title: Georgetown heritage walking tour in Chennai about the founding of Chennai

Places.description: This private tour takes you to Mahabalipuram famous for its rock cut temples dating back to the 7th century along a lovely sea shore. We will spend the day exploring this World Heritage Site of Mahabalipuram which used to serve as a sea port in ancient times. The highlights include masterpieces like the Five Chariots which are rock cut monolith temples, Arjuna's Penance the giant open air rock relief, the gravity defying Krishna's butterball and the Shore temple which is the last remaining of the 7 Pagodas mentioned by Marco Polo. This package includes pick and drop, private car, lunch, and a professional guide.
Places.title: Mahabalipuram tour by Tourism Ministry approved company

Places.description:
Sowcarpet street food is a food walking tour in Chennai to stimulate your taste buds. Street Food Tour is a great way to experience Chennai through its delectable street food. It's a multi-sensorial experience over 2 hours as we taste the signature dishes from legendary food stalls as we walk through frenetic streets, narrow alleys brimming with food stalls and colorful shops.

This tour is organized by Five Senses Tours, a private limited company recognized by the Ministry of Tourism and a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators (IATO). The tour has been designed to support local livelihoods by way of employment of local guides, and supporting local businesses in line with the mission of the company to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent.
Places.title: Sowcarpet Street Food Walking Tour in Chennai with guide

Chennai city tour is a cultural immersion in the company of a cultural evangelist and an experience of a lifetime. It is hosted by a company that is approved by the ministry of tourism and is a member of the Indian Association of Tour Operators. 

Visit the ancient town ofÂ Mylapore which used to trade pepper and fine cloth with Rome for gold. Experience mesmerizing rituals in the 7th century temples of Kapaleeswar. Learn the science behind the rituals and role of temple in modern Indian society. 

We also visit Â San Thome Basilica to see the relics of St Thomas who came here 2000 years ago. 

The other experience includes Â Ramakrishna Math the monastic organization and Fort Saint George which provides a vivid history of how the East India Company came as traders and became the rulers ofÂ India.

Mylapore walking tour in Chennai will demystify Hindu Gods & Temple rituals. It is organised by a tourism ministry approved company which is also a member of IATO. From far, the thousands of Hindu Gods and complex rituals in temples look bewildering! Our Cultural Evangelist will demystify the reason for so many Gods and purpose of Temple rituals.

Relics of St Thomas are a highlight of the Mylapore walking tour in Chennai. Visit the Shrine in San Thome Basilica to see relics like a small bone of St Thomas, the head of the lance with which the Saint was pierced and an ancient painting of Our Blessed Mother.

Mylapore walking tour in Chennai. comes with an opportunity to savor the taste of the iconic Filter Coffee of Mylapore.

Our company is committed to strengthening local communities. We help train and employ local guides and support local businesses to ensure travel dollars stay where they are spent. Our guide will be happy to talk about the community initiatives we undertake.

A treasure trove of art and architectural masterpieces and home to many rock-cut sculptures and majestic temples, Mahabalipuram is a beautiful heritage site located in the heart of Southern India. A Chennai to Mahabalipuram tour package will make sure that you enjoy and explore a wide variety of attractions, that too in a single day.

Get picked up from your stay in Chennai, followed by a transfer to Mahabalipuram. The sightseeing will start by visiting the Mahabalipuram Seashore Temple. This is one of the oldest granite stone temples in Southern Asia and exhibits the ancient finesse of art.

Discover Chennai on our exclusive private day tour led by accomplished, highly educated cultural custodians with backgrounds in History, Architecture and Fine Arts. 

This comprehensive tour of Chennai takes you to all the highlights of Chennai - Fort St George, Egmore Museum, St Thomas Basilica, St Georges Cathedral, Kapleeshwar Temple and more. 

We will engage you in lively conversations and debates about Chennai's history, share interesting facts and anecdotes, and also explore the contemporary importance and pulse of the metropolis.

Whether you're keen to delve into history, explore bustling markets, or savor authentic cuisine, this tour promises memories to last a lifetime.

If you find yourself pressed for time or simply wish to explore the tourist attractions in and around the city, our half-day city tour is the perfect choice for you.

Join us on our Trails of Pondicherry tour, where we've meticulously woven together all the captivating facets of the city to create a beautiful garland of experiences. Immerse yourself in an unparalleled heritage journey, filled with fascinating stories that unravel the essence of Pondicherry's existence, culture, and lifestyle.
Places.title: Highlights of the Chennai (Guided Half Day City Tour)

Places.description:
Join your host Sundari and experience authentic Indian life, culture and cuisine with a welcoming local in her home. Sundari will teach you to prepare 4-5 dishes as part of your South Indian vegetarian meal which you will later eat the traditional way - with your hands on stainless steel plates or fresh banana leaves. 

Your menu may include typical Tamilian vegetarian main dishes such as rasam (tangy peppery broth), sambar (lentil and tamarind based vegetable stew), and a variety of vegetable curries, rice, raita, condiments and snacks. Alternatively you may request to learn to make a South Indian brunch of dosas, idlis and vadas with a variety of chutneys instead.

Come join Sundari, and leave with new recipes, a new friend and lifelong memories!
Places.title: Traditional Cooking Class in Chennai in a Local Home with Sundari

Places.description: Join Srividya in the kitchen for a private cooking class to learn to make two to three dishes from scratch. She will teach you about a variety of South Indian culinary traditionsÂ as you cook and eat together.Â  You will sense her pride as she shares interesting anecdotes and stories that highlight the traditions and science behind the foods you will enjoy at her table. Srividya offers vegetarian food only.
Places.title: Private In-Home Vegetarian Cooking Class and Meal in Chennai

Places.description:
This is a special opportunity to visit a traditional South Indian Chettiar home near the Chennai seashore. Get picked up from your Chennai hotel and drive out of Chennai to reach Kamala's home located 5 minutes from the sea. Relax in her charming home and learn to cook South Indian dishes with an expert home cook. Kamala will teach you to make 2-3 dishes (including how to pour dosas) before you sit down together to enjoy a typical South Indian meal. You might try dishes such as Chettinad chicken, minced mutton nuggets, egg dosa, fish curry, jackfruit masala, and one of our favorites, piping hot dosas (roasted, rice pancakes) fresh off the griddle, all served on a fresh banana leaf.

Please note that this home is a 45 minute drive from the heart of Chennai, located midway between Chennai and Mahabalipuram, a popular tourist destination. Her home is alsoÂ 20 minutes away from Dakshinachitra, a beautiful open-air museum of South Indian heritage and culture.
Places.title: Learn to Cook Traditional South Indian cuisine at the Chennai seashore

Places.description:
Chennai boasts a regal legacy, steeped in centuries-old traditions of delectable cuisine. Fortunately, this rich gastronomic heritage has been lovingly preserved by generations of thoughtful individuals in the form of quaint food joints.

Embark on an extraordinary culinary journey with us, as we guide you through these hidden gems where you can savor the essence of Chennai's culinary treasures. Indulge your palate, revel in the flavors, and create unforgettable memories that will leave a lasting impression.
Places.title: Food Walk Tour Chennai

Places.description:
On this day-excursion from Chennai, visit the oldest water bird sanctuary of India. Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary is home to migratory birds such as Pintail, Garganey, Grey Wagtail, Blue-winged Teal, Common Sandpiper and many more. The best time to visit this sanctuary is from November to March when 

migratory birds are nesting here.

Highlights:
â€¢ Many small lakes in the sanctuary
â€¢ 40 000 birds including 26 rare species
â€¢ Migratory birds from countries as far away as Canada
Places.title: Visit to Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary from Chennai

Official Archaeological Survey of India guides can be hired at sites.

- You will be taken to the best locations to see maximum / rare species
- You will get enhanced birdwatching with the experienced Birding Guide and Bird call expert using high end Spotting Scope / Binocular

A fun tour with a combination of temple run and refreshing beach. After exploring the temples and the Mahabalipuram beach, just relax at the beach and visit plenty of ancient temples which were carved out of large monoliths and an wonder of ancient Indian mastery over stone.

Professional surfers can try surfing also as the waters are very rough, however it is on guests own endeavor and nothing to do with our tour.
Places.title: Mahabalipuram Temple and Beach Day Tour from Chennai

Places.description:
A private day tour designed to show off Chennai's cultural beauty

Start an immersive trip through Chennai, the city that beats the heart of Tamil Nadu and is known as the center of India's long political and cultural history. Chennai is known as the "Gateway to South India," even though it doesn't have any famous sites like the Red Fort or Marine Drive. This is because it is the oldest modern city in India.

The Coromandel Coast wraps around this city, making it a treasure trove of unmatched charm. Chennai is famous for its beautiful beaches, intricate textiles, historic sites, soul-stirring Carnatic music, and captivating classical dances. It has an old-world charm that comes from its rich history of trade, culture, and building.

Its story is told through a rich tapestry of colonial effects from the times of the British and French. Chennai is like a miniature version of Asia; it is full of different kinds of people, cultures, and customs that have been around for a long time.
Places.title: Splendid Chennai: Private Half Day Tour of Chennai

Places.description: Start your day in Chennai at the Sri Ramakrishna Math on RK Mutt Road, where you can enjoy a peaceful atmosphere for about 45 minutes. Next, visit the Kapaleeshwarar Temple to admire its stunning Dravidian architecture and vibrant gopuram, spending about an hour there. After that, take a leisurely 45-minute stroll along Marina Beach, savoring local snacks and the sea breeze.Then, head to the Shirdi Sai Baba Temple for another 45 minutes, immersing yourself in its spiritual ambiance. Follow this with a visit to Fort St. George, where you can explore the colonial museum for an hour. Afterward, make your way to Vivekananda House, dedicating 45 minutes to learn about the life and teachings of Swami Vivekananda.Conclude your day at the Santhome Cathedral Basilica, a beautiful neo-gothic church, spending 45 minutes appreciating its architecture and tranquility.Offering a rich blend of spirituality, culture, and history, making for a memorable day in Chennai.
Places.title: Explore Chennai City Tour with Guide, Lunch, and Local Highlights

Places.description: Have you ever wondered why there are so many Gods in India? Or what the stars have to do with your future? As you walk through the Mylapore neighborhood in Chennai, explore fascinating stories hidden from the mundane rituals of daily life in South India - stories of Gods and demons, and stories of ancient customs and symbolism. Mylapore is a bustling neighborhood in the heart of Chennai dated the city by at least 2,000 years and has maintained many traditions and arts that Chennai is so famous for.
Places.title: Private Peacock Trail Walking Tour in Mylapore

Places.description: Booking a Dharavi slum tour offers a unique and eye-opening experience for visitors to Mumbai. The tour is guided by local residents who can provide an authentic perspective on life in the slum. Additionally, a portion of the proceeds from the tour goes towards supporting community development projects in the area. By booking a Dharavi slum tour, visitors can gain a deeper understanding and appreciation of the city of Mumbai and it's diverse communities.
Places.title: Dharavi slum tour by the 1st female tour guide of Mumbai's slum

Every experience is customized for the guest depending upon parameters like country of origin and profession.

Places.description: The Elephanta Caves are situated in Western India on Elephanta Island (also called the Island of Gharapuri), which highlights two hillocks isolated by a tight valley. The little island is dabbed with various old archeological remaining parts that are the sole declarations to its rich social past. These archeological remaining parts uncover proof of occupation from as soon as the second century BC. The stone cut Elephanta Caves were built about the mid-fifth to sixth hundreds of years AD. The most significant among the caverns is the incomparable Cave 1, which estimates 39 meters from the front access to the back. In plan, this cavern in the western slope intently looks like Dumar Lena cave at Ellora, in India. The principal body of the cavern, barring the porches on the three open sides and the back passageway, is 27 meters square and is upheld by lines of six sections each. Elephanta Caves are an UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Places.title: Elephanta Caves & Island Guided Private Tour

They are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular destination for visitors interested in history, architecture, and religious art.

Places.title: World heritage Somnathpur sculptures and Talakadu temple mystery

Places.description:
Riding in a "tuk-tuk" (Autorickshaw) is a fun experience in itself and very unique to Asia. You can hop on and hop off at places of interest. You will be visiting some truly local and significant "Must see" spots along with a few off the guide book spaces that range from ancient temples, gothic churches, crafts markets, artisans, and a beautiful summer palace. This tour also includes a traditional southern Indian Brunch or Lunch which you can choose as you trail along. 

This is a guided experience and includes a meal.

Note: Some of the tour attractions cannot be experienced on Sundays/ Public holidays as they would be closed, that being the silk weaving and dyeing units. However, we do have an alternative option to walk about the jewellers & crafts/fabric street/market and visit a unique temple known for black magic and voodoo.
Places.title: Bengaluru by Tuk Tuk

Places.description: Bandipur is home to more than 70 Royal Bengal Tigers, and more than 3,000 Indian elephants. Also visit UNESCO protected famous "Chennakesava" temple at "Somnathpur". "The journey will start from "Bangalore"Â  and let you explore the length and breadth of the Bandipur National Park, One of the oldest national parks in the Bandipur, Bandipur National Park is a part of the Nilgiri Biosphere and is highly protected by the government. While returning to Bengaluru city, enroute visit breathtaking "Chennakesava" temple at "Somnathpur".
Places.title: Bandipur Tiger Reserve with Somnathpur Temple Tour

Places.description:
Cubbon Park Walk or more popularly known as the Namma Bengaluru Heritage Walk, is curated by Tours+, a Rustik Travel initiative to Explore, Discover and Learn about the cities, towns and the places we live in, or we visit. We cover history, culture, heritage, architecture, spirituality and more during these tours.

A tour covering Bengaluru in the form of history, myths, anecdotes, stories and more. You will learn of facts you would never would have thought of before.Â We start from Vidhan Soudha then walk through Cubbon Park and ending it at MG Road.
Places.title: Cubbon Park Walk- Namma Bengaluru Heritage Walk

Places.description: We provide you with the most convenient and affordable airport transfer from Bangalore Airport to your destination in city. In case of any flight delays our driver waits for you and will safely drive you to your destination in the city. Any part of the city can be covered within an hours time.

Places.description: Experience the best of Delhi in 8 hours with our full-day private city tour. Explore both Old and New Delhi, visiting iconic landmarks such as Jama Masjid, Khari Baoli, and Humayun's Tomb. Enjoy the comfort of a private vehicle as you pass by Chandni Chowk, the Red Fort, India Gate, Parliament House, and Rashtrapati Bhavan. Stop at Agrasen Ki Baoli and the Lotus Temple. Our knowledgeable guide provides insightful commentary, and hotel pick-up and drop-off ensure a seamless journey. Book now for a personalized, unforgettable Delhi adventure!

Places.description: Get to Agra in a comfortable and convenient way by opting for this private car tour. Places.description:
The food and Heritage walk is an experience of a lifetime, Ditching those typical tourist sites here we are exploring it in depth as a local, experiencing the local cuisine which has been passed through generations (we eat 11 to 14 different food items), and fall in love with the legacy of the great Mughal dynasty.
showing you an insight into Old Delhi is the motive that is missing in guidebooks. Feel Shahjahanabad(Old Delhi) with us.

Places.description: Discover the secret historic spots of antique Old Delhi while walking with an expert Guide. Weâ€™ve got just the ticket. Places.description:
Each region of India has its unique street food and Delhi is no exception. Visit our favorite vendors in Old Delhi and try the local specialties chole bature, dahi bhalla and aloo chat, as well as parathas, lassi and the very sweet but delicious jalebis and the local equivalent of rice pudding and bread and butter pudding. 

All of these dishes are vegetarian but meat eaters will have the option to try Indian fried chicken in the buzzing Matia Mahal neighbourhood towards the end of the tour.

In addition to sampling the best of Old Delhiâ€™s street food, we will also do some sightseeing as we explore the largest spice market in Asia, take a stroll along Chandni Chowk and stop to admire the imposing Jama Masjid. We will absorb the hustle and bustle of the narrow streets as we visit different locations by rickshaw. 

**Please note that the Spice Market has a lot less activity on Sundays. For the 1.00pm tour, there is about 50% less activity and for the 5.00pm tour, it is closed.

Our exclusiveÂ 

Golden Triangle Tour 4 Days 3 NightsÂ package brings you the best of this fantastic region which is like a hub for culture, art and breathtaking historic significance.

Places.description:
Amazingly photogenic and fabulously chaotic, the ever-pulsating heart of India is none other than Delhi. One city that is impossible to ignore, it out-and-out surprises you with an ultimate mix of age-old history, diverse culture, and lip-smacking cuisine. 

Kick-start your Delhi city tour wandering past the cacophonous Shahjahanabad (Old Delhi). Hop in for a rickshaw ride just to witness Old Delhiâ€™s thespian lanes, a multitude of street-food vendors, and astounding monuments emerging in-between clustered housing.

Places.description: Come join us as we explore Delhiâ€™s culture and art scene on this street art tour. Finally, we will show you through the Lodhi Art District, home to Delhiâ€™s street art. The art aims to represent a variety of social issues and gives a wonderful understanding of todayâ€™s India.
Places.title: Delhi Street Art Tour
